alert.note: Alert for Clark (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued March 04 at 4:01PM CST until March 05 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: .OVERVIEW...a wintry mix spreads across the area late tonight, quickly transitioning to freezing rain overnight. Ice will accrue on untreated surfaces, making travel hazardous to dangerous...potentially impossible in some areas. Travel is highly discouraged along and north of I-94 overnight into Saturday morning. ...ICE STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Significant icing expected with accumulations up to 1/4" possible. * WHERE...Clark County. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage possible. Hazardous to dangerous travel is expected.
info.instruction: Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, 511mn.org in Minnesota, and 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.
